comment.author: 39123284@N07
comment._content: This is Alois B. SALIGER, born about 1880 in the Adlergebirge area of Bohemia (Austria), immigrated about 1883. He grew up in the Lewis County, WA area. His parents were Frank and Marie Saliger. I would guess that about the time that this picture was taken, Alois was living in New York City. Alois was an inventor and businessman, owner of the Saliger Ship Salvage Company in New York. Other similar photo here: www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2163494578/

comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: I added him to Wikipedia: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alois_Benjamin_Saliger He went on to invent the psycho-phone for sleep learning. Here is a link to History Detectives where they incorrectly ascribe the invention of the device to Thomas Edison: www.pbs.org/opb/historydetectives/investigations/701_psyc...

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content: Thank you all for your information about Saliger and the correct spelling of his last name. We will update the record and database.

comment.author: 39123284@N07
comment._content: Per the digitized vital records in the State Regional Archives of Zamrsk, Czech Republic, he was born on June 30, 1880 in Batzdorf, Bohemia, which is now Bartošovice v Orlických horách in the Czech Republic.

comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: OK, I emended his Wikipedia biography with the correct information.
